meanings.definition: A small cabinet or box for holding bottles of wine or liquor.
meanings.sent1: The cellaret in the dining room was filled with bottles of wine.
meanings.sent2: She placed the new bottle of wine in the cellaret to keep it cool.
meanings.sent3: The cellaret decided it was tired of holding wine and wanted to store juice instead.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a hidden cellaret of joy, waiting to be opened.
meanings.sent5: The cellaret gleamed in the candlelight, showcasing its precious contents.

meanings.definition: A piece of furniture used for storing alcoholic beverages.
meanings.sent1: The antique cellaret was a beautiful addition to the room.
meanings.sent2: He admired the intricate carvings on the cellaret while pouring a drink.
meanings.sent3: The cellaret threw a party for all the bottles it held inside.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter spilled out of her like a well-stocked cellaret.
meanings.sent5: The cellaret stood proudly, displaying its collection of fine spirits.

meanings.definition: A container for storing and serving drinks.
meanings.sent1: She carried the cellaret to the garden party to serve refreshments.
meanings.sent2: The hostess filled the cellaret with ice to keep the drinks cold.
meanings.sent3: The cellaret felt important as it held the drinks for the guests.
meanings.sent4: His words poured out smoothly, like drinks from a well-used cellaret.
meanings.sent5: The cellaret was the life of the party, offering drinks to everyone.
